Description: Body sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery plate; dull cream slip on interior only; interior, from outside: wide band in added red; wide black band; band of red dots; black band; in tondo alternating lozenges and lotus buds; exterior: part of two narrow black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.702)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (37, pl. 18, 30)
